thread.title: Hacked Scottrade database included account numbers, and tips for buying used cars
thread.title_full: Hacked Scottrade database included account numbers, and tips for buying used cars - MarketWatch

author: Priya Anand
title: Hacked Scottrade database included account numbers, and tips for buying used cars
text:
Hello, MarketWatchers.
Scottrade hackers had access to brokerage account numbers, company reveals They were included in the database criminals accessed during a prolonged breach, the company told MarketWatch on Thursday .
Advocates press federal regulators to investigate Experian data breach Experian, one of the three major credit bureaus in the U.S., holds personal data on more than 200 million people.
Buying a used car? Read this first With hurricane season lasting from June until November, damaged cars may continue to plague consumers.
Do I have to tip my baby sitter? Six situations where it pays to give your sitter a little extra .
5 least affordable housing markets in America In five counties in America, the average worker would have to spend his entire salary to afford the mortgage payments on an average home.
Women are more likely than men to go to college But they still get paid less.
Marijuana companies struggle to find a place to put their green Federal regulations force businesses into cash-only operations .
